name: -webkit-rtl-ordering
description: Overrides ordering defaults for right-to-left content.
longDescription: The distinction between these two character orders is normally handled automatically as a side effect of character set. This property allows you to override whether the browser should treat the content as being in logical or visual order.

logical.description: Raw content is in mixed order (requiring a bidirectional renderer).

visual.description: Right-to-left content is encoded in reverse order so an entire line of text can be rendered from left to right in a unidirectional fashion.
